meanings.definition: The process of dividing a document into separate pages.
meanings.sent1: I struggled with the pagination of my essay, trying to make sure each page had the right amount of content.
meanings.sent2: The pagination of the book made it easier to find specific information quickly.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the pagination of the test was so confusing, it felt like a puzzle to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like the pagination of a book, neatly organizing thoughts into separate sections.
meanings.sent5: The pagination of the website was so user-friendly that even a child could navigate it effortlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of numbering pages in a document.
meanings.sent1: I always forget to check the pagination before submitting my reports.
meanings.sent2: The pagination at the bottom of the document helped me keep track of my progress.
meanings.sent3: The librarian's obsession with perfect pagination led to beautifully organized shelves.
meanings.sent4: The pagination on the map guided us through the winding streets of the city.
meanings.sent5: The pagination on the menu made it easy to find my favorite dish among the many options.
